tasks.task: Planting and germinating Atlantic dill giant pumpkin seeds
subtasks: Fill container with moist potting soil
Make a shallow hole in the soil for the seed (approximate depth to cover seed)
Position seed pointy end downward in the hole
Cover seed with soil without tamping it down
Provide initial watering to moisten soil
Soak seeds in warm water for 4 hours prior to planting
Transfer seeds from soaking solution to planting container
Place container in a germination station with a heat mat set to 78-80 degrees
Cover container to maintain humidity and warmth
Expose seedlings to grow light immediately after emergence to prevent legginess
Monitor for emergence of first true leaf (indicating readiness for transplantation)
Transplant seedlings outdoors once first true leaf is established, preferably when small
Consider initial direction of the first true leaf when planning vine orientation
